As my family and I continue to grieve the sudden loss of my dad, we have been so humbled and grateful for all the messages of love and appreciation for him. We have truly been held together over the last two weeks by thoughtful cards, texts, calls, and lasagnas.

He lived such a big, joyful, and generous life, it has been a tall order to know how to carry him and his legacy forward. This is what came to us, and we would be so moved if you considered honoring him by supporting a first-generation medical student in their research on heart disease and prevention.

The Xavier Barrera Memorial Endowment for Research Education in Cardiovascular Disease at the University of Texas Health Science Center Health San Antonio:

https://makelivesbetter.uthscsa.edu/barrera

ETA: You can also read his full obituary by clicking the link.

Thank you. We love you. Let‚Äôs try to mend some broken hearts.

G-PISD Administration

Join us for at upcoming informational meeting about opportunities to expand the District's Bilingual Education Program -- a great opportunity for students to become bilingual and biliterate in Spanish and English! The meetings will be held on Thursday, January 16, 2020, from 9 a.m. to 10 a.m., and again from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m., at W.C. Andrews Elementary School (4015 Moore Avenue in Portland, TX).

This program is open to all Pre-K to Grade 3 eligible G-PISD students, in every elementary attendance zone. Interested families will be able to apply for student enrollment beginning next school year (space is limited). We encourage you to join us and find out more about this program! #GPTheDestinationDistrict
